tit.e: Oomi (a government post in ancient Japan)
Oomi (a government post in ancient Japan)

sen.j: 大臣（おおおみ）とは、古墳時代におけるヤマト王権に置かれた役職の1つ。
sen.e: Ooomi was a post in the Yamato Kingdom in the Kofun period.

sen.j: 王権に従う大夫を率いて大王 (ヤマト王権)（天皇）の補佐して執政を行った。
sen.e: Ooomi assisted Ookimi, the king, in administering the country by heading Taifu who followed the Kingdom.

sen.j: カバネ（かばね）の一つである臣（おみ）の有力者が就任した。
sen.e: The leading figures who bore a Kabane title Omi were appointed Ooomi.
The leading figure among prominent leaders with a Kabane title Omi took the position of Oomi.

sen.j: 日本書紀には、最初の大臣として武内宿禰の名が見えるが、武内宿禰は実在の人物とは考えられていない。
sen.e: In "Nihonshoki", the name TAKEUCHI no Sukune appears as the first Ooomi, but he is not considered a real person.

sen.j: しかし、武内宿禰の後裔を称する葛城氏、平群氏、巨勢氏、蘇我氏などの有力氏族出身者が大臣となった。
sen.e: But the members from the powerful clans like the Kazuraki clan, the Heguri clan, the Kose clan, and the Soga clan, all of which clamed that they were descended from TAKEUCHI no Sukune, became Ooomi.

sen.j: 大臣は、各大王の治世ごとに親任され、反正天皇から安康天皇までの治世に当たる5世紀中期には葛城円が、雄略天皇から仁賢天皇までの治世に当たる5世紀後期には平群真鳥が、継体天皇の治世に当たる6世紀前期には巨勢男人が、敏達天皇から推古天皇までの治世に当たる6世紀後期から7世紀初期には蘇我馬子が、それぞれ大臣に任命された。
sen.e: Ooomi was appointed personally by Ookimi for the reign: For the reigns from Emperor Hanzei to Emperor Anko during the middle of the 5th century, KATSURAGI no Tsubura was appointed Ooomi; for the reigns from Emperor Yuryaku to Emperor Ninken during the latter half of the 5th century, HEGURI no Matori was appointed Ooomi; for the reign of Emperor Keitai during the first half of the 6th century, KOSE no Ohito was appointed Ooomi; and for the reigns of Emperor Bidatsu to Emperor Suiko from the latter half of the 6th century to the early 7th century, SOGA no Umako was appointed Ooomi.

sen.j: 蘇我馬子が大連_(古代日本)である物部守屋を討った後は大連制が事実上廃されたために馬子が単独の執政官となり、以降は蘇我氏が政権の中枢を担うようになり、大臣は蘇我蝦夷（馬子の子）が跡を継いだ。
sen.e: After SOGA no Umako defeated MONONOBE no Moriya, the Oomuraji, the system of Oomuraji was virtually abolished and Umako became the sole consul; thereafter, the Soga clan monopolized the key positions in politics and SOGA no Emishi, a son of Umako, succeeded Ooomi.

sen.j: 皇極天皇の治世に当たる645年、いわゆる乙巳の変により、蘇我蝦夷は自死し蘇我氏の隆盛は終わった。
sen.e: In 645 during the reign of Emperor Kogyoku, SOGA no Emishi killed himself in the Isshi Incident, which was the end of the prosperity of the Soga clan.

sen.j: この事変の直後に即位した孝徳天皇は、大臣に代って左大臣と右大臣を置き、権力集中の防止を図った。
sen.e: Emperor Kotoku, who was enthroned immediately after the incident, replaced Ooomi with Sadaijin and Udaijin to prevent one post from grasping the authority.
